Name: Air Chief Marshal S Hillier
Job/Team Function: CAS is the professional head of the Royal Air Force.  He is responsible for generating a balanced and integrated Royal Air Force capability, and for maintaining the fighting effectiveness and morale of the Service.  He reports to the Chief of the Defence  (CDS).  He is a member of the Defence Council and the Air Force Board, the Defence Ministerial Committee, the Defence Board, the Chiefs of Staff Committee and the Senior Appointments Committee.  He chairs the Air Force Board Standing Committee.

Name: Air Vice-Marshal M Wigston
Job Title: Assistant Chief of the Air Staff
Job/Team Function: Assisting the Chief of the Air Staff in generating a balanced and integrated Royal Air Force capability and for maintaining the fighting effectiveness and morale of the Service including the development of policy.

Name: Air Marshal S Atha
Job Title: Deputy Commander Operations and Air Member for Operations
Job/Team Function: DCom Ops is the RAF's senior warfighter, and is responsible for generating the RAF’s contribution to Operations both at home and overseas. Commanding AOCs for No 1 Gp, No 2 Gp and 38 Gp he also acts as CAS’s deputy and is in charge of the routine HQ operation on a day to day basis. DCom Ops’ intent is to enable the RAF to Force Generate agile, interoperable and capable war fighters who understand and deliver Air Power in order to meet the challenges of our standing and contingency commitments.

Name: Air Marshal S Reynolds
Job Title: Deputy Commander Capability and Air Member for Personnel and Capability
Job/Team Function: The role of DCom Cap is to provide sufficient personnel to meet the trained manpower requirement of the RAF, to ensure those personnel are trained to be capable of carrying out the tasks demanded of them, and that they are provided with the right support such that they are motivated to repeatedly and willingly deliver operational effect.  As Chair of the Air Force Capability Group, DCom Cap is also responsible for the efficient and effective development of capability for Air.  In his dual role as AMP, he provides the policies, strategies and personnel management advice to CAS to ensure that the RAF vision is deliverable now and in the longer term.

Name: Air Vice-Marshal J Chaffey
Job/Team Function: The Mission of the Royal Air Force Chaplains' Branch is to serve the Royal Air Force through Prayer, Presence and Proclamation.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Assistant Chief of Staff Media and Communications
Job/Team Function: To achieve its mission, the RAF must ensure that its role and utility are properly understood by decision makers, the wider public, and all service and civilian personnel within the RAF Whole Force.  ACOS Media and Comms is responsible for the planning and delivery of all  communications activities required to deliver this effect.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To maximise the numbers of RAF personnel fit for task and provide coherent and effective medical operational capability to facilitate an agile, adaptable and capable Air Force.

Name: Air Vice-Marshal A Mardell
Job/Team Function: To deliver high quality, effective and operationally focused legal services to the RAF and Defence.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To deliver high quality, effective and operationally focused legal services to the RAF and Defence.

Name: Air Vice-Marshal W James
Job/Team Function: The Mission of 22(Trg)Gp is to underpin the military effectiveness of the  RAF and the other Services by timely provision of appropriately trained military and civilian personnel.  The end state is an organisation that delivers mentally and physically robust individuals with a war-fighting specialist mentality ready to integrate into front-line duties.

Name: Air Vice-Marshal C Elliot
Job/Team Function: The mission of COS Pers/ Air Sec is to manage the RAF's Servicemen and women and to provide the supporting policies to enable an agile, adaptable and capable Air Force.

Name: Air Vice-Marshal S Shell
Job/Team Function: Contingency planning for future, current & contingent air ops & policy development; EW, Information Exploitation & Decision Support advice; support to SF ops; management of Flight Safety, Meteorological and Fire services; co-ordinating Air participation i

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Contingency planning for future, current & contingent air ops & policy development; EW, Information Exploitation & Decision Support advice; support to SF ops; management of Flight Safety, Meteorological and Fire services; co-ordinating Air participation i

Job/Team Function: Plan, focus, direct and sustain HQ Air's support, engineering, logistics and communications to physically assist operational commanders in generating all components of Air Power.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Air Officer A4 & A4 Force Commander
Job/Team Function: To plan, develop and deliver sustainable engineering & logistic support and A4 Force Elements to operations for AIR in the UK and the expeditionary joint arena, including transformation, policy, manpower and commodities.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Air Officer A6 & A6 Force Commander
Job/Team Function: Generating relevant, timely, sustainable, assured and agile mission information solutions across the Air environment in the expeditionary joint arena and the UK.

Name: Air Vice-Marshal G Mayhew
Job/Team Function: To generate and develop winning Combat Air Power for employment on Joint operations and to support the generation, development and sustainment of the RAF's Support Helicopter Force so that they can best meet the JHC Mission

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: All aspects of current air operations, together with the standards and training required to ensure success.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To generate and develop an adaptable and balanced Battlespace Management Force with the agility to play a key role in the delivery of air and space power.

Job/Team Function: Generate and Develop Effective Combat Support

Job/Team Function: To provide the comprehensive command and staff support required at the Operational level to direct, plan, develop and deliver the Tornado and Lightning capability and sustain force elements in order to support the delivery of Air Command’s output.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Develop the RAF's ISTAR and SAR capabilities to best contribute to the achievement of precise effects across the spectrum, whenever and where ever they are required in support of the UK's foreign and defence policy.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Air Officer Force Protection & Commandant General of the RAF Regiment
Job/Team Function: Force Protection is a fundamental enabler for air operations. It is delivered by the integration of the effects from a variety of specialist force elements and generic activity across the force.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Hd RP manages the HQ AIR planning functions including; risk management, the development of HQ AIR’s input into the Planning Round (including Military priorities), strategic policy/planning, direction and advice on Force Structure Development, managing the Air Establishment Requirement, development of the Estate Rationalisation Plan and Manpower Planning. He also provides strategic advice for the HQ AIR Equipment Plan.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To deliver high quality secretariat and business management services to support Ministers, and the RAF and to provide, through the HR Directorate and the D Res Business Management Team, support to D Res, Air in his Civilian Workforce Advisor role.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Assistant Chief of Staff Personnel Policy Delivery
Job/Team Function: Develop and implement employment and disciplinary policies that fit with the needs of our people and the demands of a modern, operational and agile service. ACOS Pers Pol also has the focus for Joint Personnel Administration, Community Support and the derivation of a Stress Management and Resilience Policy.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The primary role of the manning directorate, in apportioning manpower to fill establishments, is to balance the Service need with personal aspirations, within a framework of overall career management. The directorate manages the careers of all officers, non-commissioned aircrew and ground trades personnel.
